summary: The Northwest Energy Security Act (S.182) concerns the operation of the Federal Columbia River Power System (FCRPS). It directs the Secretaries of Interior, Energy, and the Army to operate the FCRPS consistently with the 2020 Supplemental Opinion.  The bill allows for amendments to this opinion under specific conditions (public safety or reliability), and restricts actions limiting electrical generation or navigation on the Snake River unless authorized by subsequent federal statute. It also clarifies the Secretaries' authority for maintenance and capital improvements.
